channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Fibrations and coset spaces for locally compact groups
item.description: arXiv:2408.03843v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Let $G$ be a topological group and let $K,L\subseteq G$ be closed subgroups, with $K\subseteq L$. We prove that if $L$ is a locally compact pro-Lie group, then the map $q:G/K\to G/L$ is a fibration. As an application of this, we obtain two older results by Skljarenko, Madison and Mostert.
item.dc:creator: Linus Kramer, Raquel Murat Garc\'ia

item.title: Using the KKM theorem
item.description: arXiv:2408.03921v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The KKM theorem, due to Knaster, Kuratowski, and Mazurkiewicz in 1929, is a fundamental result in fixed-point theory, which has seen numerous extensions and applications. In this paper we survey old and recent generalizations of the KKM theorem and their applications in the areas of piercing numbers, mass partition, fair division, and matching theory. We also give a few new results utilizing KKM-type theorems, and discuss related open problems.
item.dc:creator: Daniel McGinnis, Shira Zerbib
